entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

urls.title: Water companies illegally dumping sewage in England and Wales' rivers
urls.description: Treatment works are allowed to release sewage into waterways after heavy rain to stop it backing up.

text:
"... 7 of the 10 companies had treatment works that breached permits by dumping sewage before treating the specified volumes."

If true, this is a systemic failure of corporate performance & govt regulation. @Ofwat @EnvAgency @pow_rebecca @DefraGovUK 
https://t.co/ymd89kyRkw

urls.title: Water companies illegally dumping sewage in England and Wales' rivers
urls.description: Treatment works are allowed to release sewage into waterways after heavy rain to stop it backing up.

text:
I see evidence of this on nearly every river I survey...this really shouldn't be a thing in the 21st century. Little point in @EnvAgency
spending money on fish passes etc when the water companies are making the rivers uninhabitable!! https://t.co/TfpXZsQRQP

.@EnvAgency Can you please explain why you allow storm overflow pipes that do not have monitoring systems built in?

Surely you can make it a condition of licensing that all drains have to have permanent monitoring system and have to make that data publicly available.

entity.name: Scandal
entity.description: Olivia Pope, a former media relations consultant to the president, is ready to move on with her life and opens her own crisis-management firm, but she can't seem to shake ties with her past. Pope's staff includes womaniser-turned-family man Stephen Finch, slick litigator Harrison Wright and hacker extraordinaire Huck. As she moves forward it becomes clear that while her staffers may specialise in cleaning up the lives of other people, they can't seem to do the same for themselves.
